data.title: President
data.bio:
A Pharmaceutical Executive and entrepreneur with extensive business management, drug-device combination product development, human factors, industrialization, regulatory, quality and intellectual property experience. Listed inventor on over 200 issued patents domestic and abroad.

Have been working at Kymanox for ~5 years, first starting out as an Executive Advisor.

data.whatIDoHere: Project Management, DHF documentation, and regulatory affairs
data.title: Senior Scientist, Device Development
data.bio: At Kymanox Europe, my role is to support pharma, biotech, & medical device industry globally by managing the design and development of medical device/combination products (drug/device and biologic/ device combination products in EU & US) through the entire product lifecycle. Backed by a strong background in regulatory affairs, Pre-clinical/Clinical trials provide innovative, resource-efficient solutions for developing/compiling compliant technical documentation and Design Dossiers to support device/combination product submissions for Notified Body opinion, IND, BLA, NDA for the expanding Biosimilar and combination product market.  As a consultant and Project Manager my role is to provide strategic planning, develop Technical Documents/DHF& provide regulatory guidance to help our clients.

experience.location: King of Prussia, Pennsylvania, United States

workplace.title: MVG | Microwave Vision Group (SATIMO, ORBIT/FR, MVG-EMC)

experience.description: Product development and engineering

•	Lead mechanical design of prototype device systems and subsystems and provide technical guidance based on data analysis and expertise.
•	Spearhead innovation utilizing an array of brainstorming, concept generation strategies, and root cause analysis strategies.
•	Generate actionable test plans to evaluate form, fit, and function for devices, subsystems, primary containers, and components.
•	Develop custom test methods and fabricate fixtures leveraging rapid prototyping and traditional manufacturing.
•	Identify and mitigate risks associated with device functionality, reliability, safety, COGs, and manufacturing scalability.

•	Cross-functional SME for delivery device, pharmaceutical primary container design, and rapid prototyping
•	Lead mechanical engineer for novel injection systems, resulting in 7 patent applications, a proof-of-concept design, functional feasibility testing, and human factors studies to validate industrial design and instructions for use (IFU).
•	Led innovation sessions which produced 25+ invention disclosures and 5 patent applications.
•	Planned and executed Design Of Experiments (DOE) and subsequent Root Cause Analysis (RCA) for CCI improvements for novel containment systems, leveraging a global, cross-functional team
•	Supported Test Method Validation (TMV) activities to address product recall and make design improvements to products.
•	Conducted technology and product assessments

•	Launched Class I medical device from design input in 6 months.
•	Developed and conducted protocols for verification and validation of new products, manufacturing equipment, and inspection methods abiding by ISO 13485 and CFR 820 and conducted feasibility testing on product prototypes, including clinical simulations.
•	Resolved product design and manufacturing issues via bulk data trending and root-cause analysis.

Revised CAD models and drawings for developmental products. Machined products in cleanroom and shop environments. Visual and physical analytical and quality inspection on products. Destructive and non-destructive material testing. Optimization of production, maintenance, and inspection processes. Research on new polymer orthostructural products.

LabVIEW control methods for MEMs sensor response testing. Statistical processes to characterize real and simulated data (using MATLAB). Researched and prepared presentations on development of vibrating MEMS sensors.

data.whatIDoHere: I provide technical expertise and generate mechanical designs for devices, primary containers, and test fixtures. I design and execute technical ideation sessions using proven tools and strategies. I foster a positive office community.
data.title: Senior Engineer, Design and Innovation
data.bio: Lauren brings 10 years of experience in mechanical design and development of delivery systems, combination products, and pharmaceutical containment. Her work has resulted in 2 marketed medical devices (Class I, III) and 17 patent applications. She has a passion for the early stages of product development and ultimately designing devices that will improve patient lives. Lauren holds a both a BS and MS in mechanical engineering from Drexel University.

experience.location: Franklin Lakes, New Jersey, United States
experience.description:
Pioneered drug compatibility studies for various PhaSeal products in the Hazardous Drug Safety portfolio. 
Developed test methods for verification and validation of closed system transfer devices.
Culibrk RA, Arabiyat AS, DeKalb CA, Hahn MS. Modeling Sympathetic Hyperactivity in Alzheimer's Related Bone Loss. J Alzheimers Dis. 2021;84(2):647-658. doi: 10.3233/JAD-215007. PMID: 34569964.

Joined the Research & Development team in designing and revising devices destined to investigate, test, and cure diseases related to the microbiome of the GI tract. Took on an interdisciplinary role in assisting with the external device structure design, optics characterization and calibration, as well as microbial assay development and assessment.

Head of student residential life staff. Coordinated student staff and professional staff (20 persons) in events and management of all civilian residence halls (600 students+). 
Conducted diversity, radical candor, and leadership trainings.

Designed support fixtures for manufacturing and production lines. Managed the installation and use of the company’s SLA printer; assisted in start up of Tormach CNC machine. Created design for wheelchair accessory and expansion mechanism for collapsible speaker.

Conducted undergraduate research including reviews of papers on related research and development in the field of oximetric and blood chemistry monitoring systems. Furthered ideation and developmental design for a device that detects carbon monoxide concentrations in first responders. Presented findings at the Students to Scholars Symposium at Norwich University.

data.whatIDoHere: Anything related to Design Controls documentation, with an emphasis on DV/DVT
data.title: Engineer, PD&C
data.bio:
My why? Because patients matter - because PEOPLE matter - and because I know we can always do better. 
As an individual in the engineering and life sciences consulting sector, I seek to always grow in exposure to and development of new processes, novel solutions, and innovative approaches to solving the challenges of the biomechanical field we face today. With a foundation built from a B.S. in Mechanical Engineering with a Biology minor, and supported by a Master's in Biomedical Engineering, I strive to continue my development as a T-shaped teammate on every project I am able to be a part of.

experience.description:
•	Support test method development and Design Verification tasks for various clients developing combination products.
•	Lead Test Method Validation planning and execution activities to support Design Verification stage in product lifecycle 
•	Perform test method characterization activities to achieve optimal parameters for testing 
•	Develop test method programs on lab equipment (Instron, Keyence)

experience.role: Engineer II - Sustaining and Product Continuity
experience.description:
•	Provided technical expertise in design controls to develop technical strategy for compliance to FDA/EUMDR regulatory standards.
•	Facilitated and led technical meetings amongst cross functional groups, preparing monthly reports to ensure effective communication of ideas, information, and issues to appropriate stakeholders.
•	Served as a technical project manager and oversaw scope, budget, and schedule of various change control projects.

•	Led testing activities for medical device regulatory support, focusing on product reliability testing:
•	Facilitated training activities to T&E technicians on calibrated lab equipment.
•	Streamlined project plans, timelines, and resourcing through use of Microsoft Projects.
•	Evaluated statistics for mechanical test data through process capability analysis using Minitab software.
•	Documented test results through technical report writing for product DHF and regulatory submittal (i.e. EUMDR, FDA submissions)

experience.role: New Product Development (NPD) Engineer - Product Integrity, Co-Op
experience.description:
As an NPD Engineer Co-Op at Terumo, I support design projects as part of the Product Integrity team. This department is primarily focused on ensuring that the design controls of each project are properly executed. Working with the 
systems engineers I have done the following: 


• Prototyped and performed mechanical and material testing on developmental projects 

• Assessed numerical data of real-time aging testing through statistical analysis on Minitab 

• Remediated documents that allowed for better traceability of Input/Output design controls 

• Input data of clinical trial studies conducted by the PI team

Project focused on creating a thermal management system for transfemoral prostheses. This project requires knowledge of fluid mechanics and pump systems. My responsibilities focus heavily on running biomechanical testing based off of theoretical fluidic and thermodynamic calculations.

In the biomechanics lab, I have experience working with a rat model of spinal cord injury, and capturing 3D kinematics of the walking rats with programs such as MATLAB and Python. I performed gait analysis tests of multiple rodents under IACUC protocol and analyzed animal tracking videos using MATLAB and motion capture software. The result has been the award of a $714,000 grant from the Shriner’s Hospitals for Children, which will allow the lab to pursue the goal of improving the functional recovery of those living with spinal cord injury.

data.whatIDoHere: I work on the PD&C team helping support activities focused on GMP test method development and other Ad-Hoc engineering studies in the KOP lab.
data.title: Engineer, PD&C
data.bio: I'm an ambitious mid-level engineer who employs collaboration, adaptivity and a diligent work ethic every day.

experience.description:
Let me help you solve your medical device and combination product engineering challenges! With 15 years of experience in the healthcare space, I have demonstrated capabilities in problem solving, investigations, product development, sustaining, change management, design control, risk management and more. 


*Open to W2, 1099 or Corporation to Corporation contract arrangements. 

*Can accommodate mainland US and international time zones. 

*15 years of medical device and combination product engineering expertise. 

*Investigations, complaints, manufacturing, R&D, product development, design control, risk management and DHF remediation services. 
*Please reach out to me on LinkedIn!

I led several medical device and combination product development projects and sustaining product support engineering across multiple product families, including premixed IV bags and reconstitution devices.

(7 months) 
As part of a six-month secondment (temporary work arrangement), I led the Platform Device Engineering Lifecycle Management team through program and resource planning and strategic initiatives with oversight for execution.

• Manage Baxter’s premier R&D early career leadership development program, including $3.7M budget 

• Recruited, hired, trained, coached, mentored and managed 50+ full time and 120+ temporary, high-potential, science and engineering millennial and Gen Z talent 

• Expanded diversity talent pipeline by conceiving and launching high school STEM internship program 

• Designed and implemented comprehensive training & development curriculum after multi-level evaluation of stakeholder needs.

• Owned and executed 20+ design changes for on-market at-home and in- center dialysis devices spanning design transfer to end of life 
• Managed engineers who contributed to $550,000+ savings, 6 CAPAs and 12 design changes 

• Trained 75+ medical device professionals by organizing 3 two-day trainings, coordinating 15 trainers 

• Increased team change control productivity by 60% and 80% YOY, reduced cycle time by 46%

• Led team of 10+ contractors to remediate 5 product design history files, create 50+ design deliverables for IV administration set parts, including clamps, tubing, packaging, Luers, Y-sites 

• Managed team of 8+ contractors in new product development activities for suite of 10 disposable fluid administration devices, including risk management, design history file compilation, requirement creation & traceability, and label copy creation

experience.location: Round Lake, IL; Irvine, CA; Hayward, CA
experience.description:
As part of Baxter’s premier R&D rotational development program:

• Led team of 3 lab technicians to conduct Design of Experiments on anesthetic container valve, identified and resolved design faults via material change 
• Developed drop test method and fixture in accordance with ASME standards 
• Optimized process maps to reduce complaint handling cycle time by 30% 
• Saved $137,000 direct labor cost by developing scheduling board during Kaizen (Lean Six Sigma) 
• Remediated two DHFs, identified and bridged 110+ gaps, including creation of plant-wide process control plans and process FMEAs 
• Conducted three Gage R&R studies (flow, burst and bubble point tests), analyzed data in Minitab, and redesigned processes to resolve low manufacturing reproducibility
In this paid role, I designed a first-of-its-kind electromechanical medical data logger for use in a pioneering study of emergency medicine.
In this crazy fun internship, I tested products and redesigned components for Swimways' line of pool toys.
In this introductory internship, I performed foundational engineering testing on Zimmer's line of orthopedic surgical products, including packaging, tensile and burst testing.

data.whatIDoHere: I am excited to be consulting for Kymanox and look forward to building my consulting skills after 15 years working on the client side!
data.title: Principal Engineer, PD&C
data.bio:
— I am an adaptable, results-oriented medical device and combination product engineer achieving success with excellence across development, sustaining and project management domains. 

— I have 15 years of experience in medical device and combo product engineering, including development, post-launch support, end of life, and everything in between! 

— Contact me if you are interested in my engineering services. I offer flexible services, full time or part time, on W2 or 1099 arrangements, and am excited to join agency rosters for current and future opportunities!
